div.head: 3.6.1884 Dienstag
div.p: Started from Hamburg at 8.22 this morning. Arrived here at 2. Had table d’hote then went down to the promenade and got two horses. Aunt Lulu took two men and a stone to get her on. We went to the top of the Burgberg with the column Unbekannt, Canossa-Säule with „Nach Canossa gehen wir nicht“ on it and the two Walküren. From there we went through the most beautiful forest to the Rabenklippen from where we had a beautiful view of the Brocken. Then we rode on to the Sennhütte got off near the Philosophenweg and walked home by it. There is a fearful storm while I am writing this. It is pouring. I hope it will be finer tomorrow: It is thundering and lightning fearfully. We are living at the Actien-hotel. Very dear and not particularly good. The storm is fearful. The rolling of the thunder is almost uninterrupted. As we were very late in starting from Hamburg aunt Lulu’s hatbox chose the very minute when we were taring madly along the platform for letting it’s bottom come out so that we had to rush on one with the hat the ribbons streaming behind the other with the pieces of the hatbox to catch the train. Arrived here aunt Lulu found that her ink bottle which she had put into her trunk had broken and made everything black; so she tried to mop it up with the hotel towel which did not do any good and only blackened the towel so that she had to sit up half the night washing it and had a grand fight with the hotel people who wanted to charge her for it. Then her „réveil matin“ which she had set on 7.30 the next morning woke her at four at which time she got up and rung violently for the maid and abused her for not waking her as it was already nine. So we are living in violent strife with all the hotelpeople.
